books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.notes: A masterpiece about the American Dream. The symbolism and writing style are exceptional.

books.title: Atomic Habits
books.author: James Clear
books.notes: Great practical advice on building good habits. The 1% better every day concept is powerful.

books.author: George Orwell
books.notes: Eerily relevant to modern times. The surveillance state concepts are thought-provoking.

books.title: The Pragmatic Programmer
books.author: Andrew Hunt and David Thomas
books.notes: Essential reading for any software developer. Timeless principles and best practices.

books.title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
books.author: Yuval Noah Harari
books.notes: Fascinating perspective on human evolution and society. Changes how you think about humanity.

books.title: Clean Code
books.author: Robert C. Martin
books.notes: On my reading list for improving code quality.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.notes: Powerful story about justice and morality. Scout is an unforgettable narrator.

books.title: The Lean Startup
books.author: Eric Ries
books.notes: Great insights on building products iteratively. The MVP concept is revolutionary.

books.title: Designing Data-Intensive Applications
books.author: Martin Kleppmann
books.notes: Highly recommended by colleagues. Want to deepen my understanding of distributed systems.

books.title: The Hobbit
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.notes: Classic fantasy adventure. Bilbo's journey is captivating and the world-building is incredible.
